title: Top performers, Oct. 21, 2015
text:
Top performers, Oct. 21, 2015 Football Shota Sprunger, Yokota: Rushed only 11 times, but for 214 yards, including five touchdown runs of 23 yards or more to give him the Far East Division II lead in touchdowns with 16 and power the Panthers past Zama 49-14. Miles Mahlock, Kubasaki: Caught seven passes for 148 yards and two touchdowns, giving him 617 yards and seven TDs on 27 catches this season, lifting the Dragons to a 49-7 home win over Nile C. Kinnick. Jason Bland, Kadena: Ran for three touchdowns, giving him a Division I-leading 14 rushing TDs on the season and the Panthers a 37-6 win at Seoul American. Jaylin Barmer, Humphreys: Rushed six times for 90 yards and two touchdowns in limited action, boosting the Blackhawks to a 21-0 shutout of Osan and a season sweep of the Cougars, in which the senior scored five touchdowns on nine rushes. Jack Ambrosino, American School In Japan: Went 9-for-14 for 149 yards and two touchdowns in just his second start, lifting the Mustangs to their second win of the season, 48-16 at Robert D. Edgren. Girls volleyball Coko Magby, Robert D. Edgren: Scored 14 kills as the Eagles, playing without centerpiece player Kalean Middleton, swept two matches in four sets each at Zama, helping keep Edgren unbeaten in regular-season play against DODDS opponents. Courtney Kait, Kubasaki: Recorded 23 set assists in the championship match, leading the Dragons to a 25-22, 25-23 win over host ASIJ in the first ASIJ-Yujo Tournament. Cross country Arlene Avalos, Kinnick: Won the DODDS Japan finals at Citizens Park in Misawa, helping lead five girls runners in the top 10 as the Red Devils won both the boys and girls team titles. Johnathon Johnson, Kubasaki, and Wren Renquist, Kadena: Each won their respective races in the Okinawa district finals, Johnson in a time of 16 minutes, 50 seconds, and Renquist in 19:35. Tennis Shaun Freeman and Maddie Howard, Kadena: Won their respective final matches in the Okinawa district singles finals, Freeman beating Kubasaki’s Adam Sami 6-0, 6-1 and Howard rallying past the Dragons’ Haley Agra 4-6, 6-4, 6-2. Join the conversation and share your voice.
